integer.name: maxActive
integer.caption: Max active
integer.description: Controls the maximum number of connections that can be borrowed from the pool at one time. When set to a negative value, there is no limit to the number of connections that may be active at one time. When maxActive is exceeded, the pool is said to be exhausted.

integer.name: maxIdle
integer.caption: Max idle
integer.description: Controls the maximum number of connections that can sit idle in the pool at any time. When set to a negative value, there is no limit to the number of connections that may be idle at one time.

enum.name: initialisationPolicy
enum.caption: Initialisation policy
enum.description: Determines how connections in a pool should be initialized. The possible values are: INITIALISE_NONE (will not load any connection into the pool on startup), INITIALISE_ONE (will load one initial connection into the pool on startup), or INITIALISE_ALL (will load all connections in the pool on startup)

enum.name: exhaustedAction
enum.caption: Exhausted action
enum.description: Specifies the behavior of the connection pool when the pool is exhausted. Possible values are: "WHEN_EXHAUSTED_FAIL", which will throw a NoSuchElementException, "WHEN_EXHAUSTED_WAIT", which will block by invoking Object.wait(long) until a new or idle object is available, or WHEN_EXHAUSTED_GROW, which will create a new connection and return it, essentially making maxActive meaningless. If a positive maxWait value is supplied, it will block for at most that many milliseconds, after which a NoSuchElementException will be thrown. If maxThreadWait is a negative value, it will block indefinitely.

integer.name: maxWait
integer.caption: Max wait
integer.description: When exhausted action is Wait (or block) this is the amount of time in milliseconds that the pool will wait before failing. Setting a negative value will block indefinitely until an idle instance becomes available.

integer.name: minEvictionMillis
integer.caption: Min eviction (ms)
integer.description: Determines the minimum amount of time a connection may sit idle in the pool before it is eligible for eviction. When non-positive, no connections will be evicted from the pool due to idle time alone.

integer.name: evictionCheckIntervalMillis
integer.caption: Eviction check interval (ms)
integer.description: Specifies the number of milliseconds between runs of the connection evictor. When non-positive, no connection evictor is executed.

label.name: connectionLabel
label.caption: Define how mule should attempt to handle a connection failure

radioBoolean.name: noReconnection
radioBoolean.caption: Do not use a Reconnection strategy

radioBoolean.name: standardReconnection
radioBoolean.caption: Standard Reconnection
radioBoolean.description: A reconnection strategy that allows the user to configure how many times a reconnection should be attempted and how long to wait between attempts.

integer.name: reconnectionAttemps
integer.caption: Reconnection Attempts
integer.description: How many reconnection attempts to make

boolean.name: reconnectForever
boolean.caption: Reconnect Forever
boolean.description: A reconnection strategy that retries an infinite number of times at the specified frequency.

classname.name: class
classname.caption: Class
classname.description: A class that implements the RetryPolicyTemplate interface.

cloud-connector-message-source.caption: Salesforce (Streaming)
cloud-connector-message-source.description:
The Salesforce Connector will allow to connect to the Salesforce application using regular username and password via the SOAP API. Almost every operation that can be done via the Salesforce's API can be done thru this connector. This connector will also work if your Salesforce objects are customized with additional fields or even you are working with custom objects.
Integrating with Salesforce consists of web service calls utilizing XML request/response setup over an HTTPS connection. The technical details of this connection such as request headers, error handling, HTTPS connection, etc. are all abstracted from the user to make implementation quick and easy. .

string.name: topic
string.caption: Topic
string.description: The name of the topic to subscribe to.

global-cloud-connector.caption: Salesforce: Basic authentication
global-cloud-connector.description:
Global Basic authentication configuration information. The Salesforce Connector will allow to connect to the Salesforce application using regular username and password via the SOAP API. Almost every operation that can be done via the Salesforce's API can be done thru this connector. This connector will also work if your Salesforce objects are customized with additional fields or even you are working with custom objects.
Integrating with Salesforce consists of web service calls utilizing XML request/response setup over an HTTPS connection. The technical details of this connection such as request headers, error handling, HTTPS connection, etc. are all abstracted from the user to make implementation quick and easy. .

name.name: name
name.caption: Name
name.description: Give a name to this configuration so it can be later referenced by config-ref.

string.name: username
string.caption: Username
string.description: Username used to initialize the session.

password.name: password
password.caption: Password
password.description: Password used to authenticate the user.

string.name: securityToken
string.caption: Security Token
string.description: User's security token. It can be omitted if your IP has been whitelisted on Salesforce.

string.name: url
string.caption: Url
string.description: Salesforce endpoint URL.

string.name: proxyHost
string.caption: Proxy Host
string.description: Hostname of the proxy.

string.name: proxyUsername
string.caption: Proxy Username
string.description: Username used to authenticate against the proxy.

password.name: proxyPassword
password.caption: Proxy Password
password.description: Password used to authenticate against the proxy.

string.name: sessionId
string.caption: Session Id
string.description: This value could be used for specifying an active Salesforce session. Please take into account you must specify all the connection parameters anyway since they will be used in case of needing a reconnection.

string.name: serviceEndpoint
string.caption: Service Endpoint
string.description: Specifies the service endpoint. This value will only be used in case of using sessionId configuration property. Otherwise the service endpoint will be retrieved from the login results.

string.name: assignmentRuleId
string.caption: Assignment Rule Id
string.description:
The ID of a specific assignment rule to run for the Case or Lead. The assignment rule can be active or inactive. The ID can be retrieved by querying the AssignmentRule object. If specified, do not specify useDefaultRule. This element is ignored for accounts, because all territory assignment rules are applied.
If the value is not in correct ID format (15-character or 18-character Salesforce ID), the call fails and a MALFORMED_ID exception is returned.

string.name: clientId
string.caption: Client Id
string.description: Client ID for partners.

string.name: timeObjectStore-ref
string.caption: Time Object Store Reference
string.description: A ObjectStore instance to use in.

integer.name: batchSobjectMaxDepth
integer.caption: Batch Sobject Max Depth
integer.description: Creating a batch will create SObjects using this value for the MAX_DEPTH check.

boolean.name: allowFieldTruncationSupport
boolean.caption: Allow Field Truncation Support
boolean.description:
If true, truncate field values that are too long, which is the behavior in API versions 14.0 and earlier.
Default is false: no change in behavior. If a string or textarea value is too large, the operation fails and the fault code STRING_TOO_LONG is returned.

boolean.name: useDefaultRule
boolean.caption: Use Default Rule
boolean.description: If true for a Case or Lead, uses the default (active) assignment rule for a Case or Lead. If specified, do not specify an assignmentRuleId. If true for an Account, all territory assignment rules are applied, and if false, no territory assignment rules are applied.

name.name: name
name.caption: Name
name.description: Give a name to this configuration so it can be later referenced by config-ref.

string.name: consumerKey
string.caption: Consumer Key
string.description: Your application's client identifier (consumer key in Remote Access Detail).

string.name: consumerSecret
string.caption: Consumer Secret
string.description: Your application's client secret (consumer secret in Remote Access Detail).

enum.name: onNoToken
enum.caption: On No Token
enum.description: Action to take when no token is found.

string.name: apiVersion
string.caption: Api Version
string.description: Salesforce API version.

string.name: assignmentRuleId
string.caption: Assignment Rule Id
string.description:
The ID of a specific assignment rule to run for the Case or Lead. The assignment rule can be active or inactive. The ID can be retrieved by querying the AssignmentRule object. If specified, do not specify useDefaultRule. This element is ignored for accounts, because all territory assignment rules are applied.
If the value is not in correct ID format (15-character or 18-character Salesforce ID), the call fails and a MALFORMED_ID exception is returned.

string.name: clientId
string.caption: Client Id
string.description: Client ID for partners.

string.name: timeObjectStore-ref
string.caption: Time Object Store Reference
string.description: A ObjectStore instance to use in.

integer.name: batchSobjectMaxDepth
integer.caption: Batch Sobject Max Depth
integer.description: Creating a batch will create SObjects using this value for the MAX_DEPTH check.

boolean.name: allowFieldTruncationSupport
boolean.caption: Allow Field Truncation Support
boolean.description:
If true, truncate field values that are too long, which is the behavior in API versions 14.0 and earlier.
Default is false: no change in behavior. If a string or textarea value is too large, the operation fails and the fault code STRING_TOO_LONG is returned.

boolean.name: useDefaultRule
boolean.caption: Use Default Rule
boolean.description: If true for a Case or Lead, uses the default (active) assignment rule for a Case or Lead. If specified, do not specify an assignmentRuleId. If true for an Account, all territory assignment rules are applied, and if false, no territory assignment rules are applied.

globalRef.name: config-ref
globalRef.caption: Connector Configuration
globalRef.description: Specify which configuration to use for this invocation.

cloud-connector.caption: Salesforce
cloud-connector.description:
The Salesforce Connector will allow to connect to the Salesforce application using regular username and password via the SOAP API. Almost every operation that can be done via the Salesforce's API can be done thru this connector. This connector will also work if your Salesforce objects are customized with additional fields or even you are working with custom objects.
Integrating with Salesforce consists of web service calls utilizing XML request/response setup over an HTTPS connection. The technical details of this connection such as request headers, error handling, HTTPS connection, etc. are all abstracted from the user to make implementation quick and easy. .

string.name: jobId
string.caption: Job Id
string.description: The Job ID identifying the Job to be aborted.

string.name: accessTokenId
string.caption: Access Token Id
string.description: The id of the access token that will be used to authenticate the call.

string.name: state
string.caption: State
string.description: Any value that you wish to be sent with the callback.

string.name: accessTokenUrl
string.caption: Access Token Url
string.description: The URL defined by the Service Provider to obtain an access token.

string.name: authorizationUrl
string.caption: Authorization Url
string.description: The URL defined by the Service Provider where the resource owner will be redirected to grant authorization to the connector.

string.name: accessTokenId
string.caption: Access Token Id
string.description: The id of the access token that will be used to authenticate the call.

string.caption: Access Token Id
string.description: The id of the access token that will be used to authenticate the call.

string.name: accessTokenId
string.caption: Access Token Id
string.description: The id of the access token that will be used to authenticate the call.

string.name: accessTokenId
string.caption: Access Token Id
string.description: The id of the access token that will be used to authenticate the call.

string.name: jobId
string.caption: Job Id
string.description: The Job ID identifying the Job to be closed.

string.name: accessTokenId
string.caption: Access Token Id
string.description: The id of the access token that will be used to authenticate the call.

string.name: accountId
string.caption: Account Id
string.description: ID of the Account into which the lead will be merged. Required only when updating an existing account, including person accounts. If no accountID is specified, then the API creates a new account. To create a new account, the client application must be logged in with sufficient access rights. To merge a lead into an existing account, the client application must be logged in with read/write access to the specified account. The account name and other existing data are not overwritten. For information on IDs, see ID Field Type.

string.name: contactId
string.caption: Contact Id
string.description: ID of the Contact into which the lead will be merged (this contact must be associated with the specified accountId, and an accountId must be specified). Required only when updating an existing contact.IMPORTANT if you are converting a lead into a person account, do not specify the contactId or an error will result. Specify only the accountId of the person account. If no contactID is specified, then the API creates a new contact that is implicitly associated with the Account. To create a new contact, the client application must be logged in with sufficient access rights. To merge a lead into an existing contact, the client application must be logged in with read/write access to the specified contact. The contact name and other existing data are not overwritten (unless overwriteLeadSource is set to true, in which case only the LeadSource field is overwritten). For information on IDs, see ID Field Type.

string.name: convertedStatus
string.caption: Converted Status
string.description: Valid LeadStatus value for a converted lead. Required. To obtain the list of possible values, the client application queries the LeadStatus object, as in: Select Id, MasterLabel from LeadStatus where IsConverted=true.

string.name: leadId
string.caption: Lead Id
string.description: ID of the Lead to convert. Required. For information on IDs, see ID Field Type.

string.name: opportunityName
string.caption: Opportunity Name
string.description: Name of the opportunity to create. If no name is specified, then this value defaults to the company name of the lead. The maximum length of this field is 80 characters. If doNotCreateOpportunity argument is true, then no Opportunity is created and this field must be left blank; otherwise, an error is returned.

boolean.name: doNotCreateOpportunity
boolean.caption: Do Not Create Opportunity
boolean.description: Specifies whether to create an Opportunity during lead conversion (false, the default) or not (true). Set this flag to true only if you do not want to create an opportunity from the lead. An opportunity is created by default.

boolean.name: overWriteLeadSource
boolean.caption: Over Write Lead Source
boolean.description: Specifies whether to overwrite the LeadSource field on the target Contact object with the contents of the LeadSource field in the source Lead object (true), or not (false, the default). To set this field to true, the client application must specify a contactId for the target contact.

boolean.name: sendEmailToOwner
boolean.caption: Send Email To Owner
boolean.description: Specifies whether to send a notification email to the owner specified in the ownerId (true) or not (false, the default).

string.name: accessTokenId
string.caption: Access Token Id
string.description: The id of the access token that will be used to authenticate the call.

string.caption: Start Time Reference
string.description: Starting date/time (Coordinated Universal Time (UTC)not local timezone) of the timespan for which to retrieve the data. The API ignores the seconds portion of the specified dateTime value ' (for example, 12:30:15 is interpreted as 12:30:00 UTC).

string.name: endTime
string.caption: End Time Reference
string.description: Ending date/time (Coordinated Universal Time (UTC)not local timezone) of the timespan for which to retrieve the data. The API ignores the seconds portion of the specified dateTime value (for example, 12:35:15 is interpreted as 12:35:00 UTC). If not specific, the current server time will be used.

integer.name: initialTimeWindow
integer.caption: Initial Time Window
integer.description: Time window (in minutes) used to calculate the start time (in time range) the first time this operation is called. E.g: if initialTimeWindow equals 2, the start time will be the current time (now) minus 2 minutes, then the range to retrieve the updated object will be (now - 2 minutes; now). After first call the start time will be calculated from the object store getting the last time this operation was exec.
